issues.title: Frontend doesn`t see backend
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
Frontend doesn`t see backend. Docker start container successfully but on the "http://localhost:3000/" page I see "System offline. Deploy backend first." message.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Follow instruction from README file
2. Finnaly run command "start ./start_services.cmd full"
3. Open in web browser "http://localhost:3000/"

**Expected behavior**
I can send requests on the "http://localhost:3000/" page.

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bab463ac-e8c2-4be9-8881-777de13c3d48)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c5d2278a-5686-43f3-b83a-6c8e0301c4e5)

**LLM Model used**
deepseek-r1:32b

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 11
 - Browser chrome, safari

**Additional context**
```
In backend log I see some errors like:
backend   | {"timestamp":"2025-06-11T14:21:31.338102Z","level":"WARN","fields":{"message":"Reqwest(reqwest::Error { kind: Request, url: \"https://transfer.xethub.hf.co/xorbs/default/eedc81f774e36ce1e8b9153775c28675fe77d1192f36c1f27e22b280f751d189?X-Xet-Signed-Range=bytes%3D30396343-33192036&Expires=1749653815&_&Signature=lX3b16PK84oIwSywwjZn6zDgCICRBkwldxUPwCslCycMn4-8iP4jHr1b41UTM1I5PGgibiYPPNDtwWNqm5T1bNb8m4AnzrHasGx9Tfzx0JyU~A0dgs2GOdBLa69GG0W2ZNJcroYHDu7wp1qrJ0VCfNuDbhZTbeGetRq323-Oq6n1LdwehhSEQZ8fXGaaYAijuQjbbfmC8y9qhg4wXN9l5bCs3tcBT-FKxcBaWuB9cJRCeP-4PASaI1pyEvf4G35VfwuLRErkBy91Z3F-Y6I2cg-7p0VvCsZMT4G1jgFBsYOQtGa7gQNsBp9tfKbwe17L9f-e1XLd9lZvRgYUkykqwg__&Key-Pair-Id=K2L8F4GPSG1IFC\", source: hyper_util::client::legacy::Error(SendRequest, hyper::Error(IncompleteMessage)) }). Retrying..."},"filename":"/home/runner/work/xet-core/xet-core/cas_client/src/http_client.rs","line_number":200}
backend   | {"timestamp":"2025-06-11T14:21:31.338144Z","level":"WARN","fields":{"message":"Retry attempt #1. Sleeping 1.329058395s before the next attempt"},"filename":"/root/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/reqwest-retry-0.7.0/src/middleware.rs","line_number":171}
```

issues.title: feat: Make API base‚ÄëURL configurable for front‚Äëend
issues.body:
## What problem does this solve? Right now the React front‚Äëend hard‚Äëcodes `http://localhost:8000` when it calls the FastAPI back‚Äëend. If the app is hosted on another machine (e.g., `http://raspberrypi.local:8000`) the UI still points to `localhost`, so requests fail when opened from a different device on the same network. ## Proposed solution Allow the front‚Äëend to read the base URL from configuration so users can: 1. Deploy the back‚Äëend on any LAN host / Docker container, and 2. Access the UI from multiple devices without recompiling or editing source. ### Implementation Plan | Approach | Pros | Cons | |--------|------|------| | **`.env` file inside `/frontend/agentic-seek-front`** (e.g., `VITE_API_BASE_URL=http://raspberrypi.local:8000`) | ‚Ä¢ Follows typical Vite/React pattern
‚Ä¢ No code change on the back‚Äëend | ‚Ä¢ Adds a second config surface separate from existing `config.ini` | ```js // frontend/agentic-seek-front/src/App.js const api = import.meta.env.VITE_API_BASE_URL || 'http://localhost:8000'; ``` ## Acceptance criteria - [ ] Local dev (`npm run dev`) still defaults to `http://localhost:8000` when no env var is set - [ ] Production build (`npm run build`) reads `VITE_API_BASE_URL` (or equivalent) and fetches from that host - [ ] README updated with a one‚Äëliner on how to set the variable for remote deployments, perhaps with a .env.example like in the repo root ## Next steps If this direction looks good I‚Äôll: 1. open a branch `feat/configurable-base-url-` 2. update the front‚Äëend config (+ docs) 3. submit a PR referencing this issue (`Closes #XYZ`) Let me know which config path you‚Äôd prefer, or if there‚Äôs an existing pattern I missed.¬†Thanks!
issues.author: strnadchristopher

issues.title: Full docker-compose deployment
issues.body:
This is the issue for integration of a full docker-compose deployment of AgenticSeek.

Goal -> Deploy all agenticSeek services:
- redis
- searxng
- frontend
- backend

Currently the start_services.sh (which use docker-compose) allow to deploy all services beside **backend**. The backend service is currently commented out in docker-compose.yml.

PR #154 by **tcsenpai** is a preview of current attempt to fix and include backend service in deployment.

Internal ports:
- 6379 -> redis
- 8080 -> searxng
- 3000 -> frontend
- 8000 -> backend
host ports (host.docker.internal extra hosts):
- 11434 -> ollama
- 1234 -> lm-studio

Some consideration:

- We would have to have other "standard" port to support other llm provider. For example if someone use llama.cpp server they would need to know what port is supported.

- Backend should have outbound internet access needed for remote APIs provider and "server" provider.

- The work_dir will need to be an environment variable. The config.ini would have `work_dir = ${WORK_DIR}`.

- The docker for backend would need to mount the work_dir folder from the host. We need  a way to ensure that work_dir is not a root folder or overly large folder (should not mount `/`, `C:\system32` or similar). Perhaps the ./start_services.sh script could check the work_dir path and size before running docker-compose

- All readme would need to be updated according to change. For example having WORK_DIR as an environment variable instead of defined in config.ini would need to be explained.

- How to make text to speech work if running inside docker ?
issues.author: Fosowl

issues.title: Frontend improvement
issues.body:
Enhance the current design: Improve the UI/UX to improve usability, aesthetics, and user experience.

Fix duplicate message bugs: Resolve issues causing duplicate messages to appear in the frontend.

Improve browser screenshot streaming: The currently approach for streaming of screenshots is probably wrong and kind of glitchy.

Enhance editor view: Improve the functionality and user experience of the editor view, fix bugs.

Fix status message updates: Address the issue where status messages are not being updated correctly by agents.

Add markdown support for left pane view.

More readable command/code output.
issues.author: Fosowl

issues.title: Windows Compatibility: "Tool: bash" Agent Generates Incompatible Commands & File Operation Issues
issues.body:
I am trying this on my computer with the help of gemini 2.5 pro to try to fix issues.untill now it helped me resolve all issues wich did arise.but now it sugested i write this in bug report because we cant get any further.
sorry for my englis... not my first language.



**Describe the bug**
When running AgenticSeek on Windows 11, agents that are designated with Tool: bash (as seen in the internal agent logs/browser output) attempt to execute commands that are often incompatible with the Windows Command Prompt (CMD.exe), which appears to be the shell environment these commands are executed in. This leads to errors and incorrect behavior for file manipulation and script execution tasks.

Bash-Specific Syntax in CMD:

Commands generated by the agent frequently include bash-specific syntax. For example, using # at the beginning of a line for comments:
```
Tool: bash
# Verify file creation and content
type F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt
Feedback: [failure] Error in execution: Command cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && # Verify file creation and contenttype F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt failed with return code 1: '#' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
```
This immediately fails in Windows CMD.
Another example is the use of echo -e for interpreting backslash escapes (like \n for newlines):
Command Generated: cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && echo -e "Movie1\nMovie2\nMovie3" > movies.txt
Actual Result on Windows: The file movies.txt is created containing the literal string -e "Movie1\nMovie2\nMovie3", not the movies on separate lines. AgenticSeek reported this as [success] presumably because the command ran without an OS error, but the output was incorrect.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

File Not Found Errors:

Even when a command is syntactically valid for Windows CMD (e.g., after the agent "corrects" a command by removing the #), it sometimes fails because the target file wasn't found:
```
Tool: bash
type F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt
Feedback: [failure] Error in execution: Command cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && type F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt failed with return code 1: The system cannot find the file specified.
```
This suggests that the preceding step (which should have created the file) might also be failing or saving the file in an unexpected way/location.

Unsafe Command" Aborts by AgenticSeek:

When attempting to write a multi-line Python script to a .py file using an echo "..." > script.py command (even if the syntax was made CMD-compatible), AgenticSeek's internal safety filter aborted the action:
```
Tool: bash
cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && echo "python_script_content..." > news_scraper.py
Feedback: [failure] Error in execution: Unsafe command: {command}. Execution aborted. This is beyond allowed capabilities report to user.
```
This prevents agents from creating scripts or more complex files using this method.

Impact:
These issues make it difficult for AgenticSeek to reliably perform tasks on Windows that involve file system manipulation, script creation, or command execution via agents relying on the "bash" tool. The agent often gets stuck in a loop of failing commands or reports task failure.

Attempted Mitigation (Modifying Agent Prompt):
I attempted to modify the prompt for the file_agent (found in file_agent.txt) to explicitly instruct the LLM to generate Windows CMD-compatible commands even when using the "bash" tool. This helped reduce the # comment errors but did not fully resolve issues like the echo -e usage or the "Unsafe command" blocks.

Expected Behavior:
For robust Windows support, agents performing shell operations should:

Generate commands compatible with the native Windows shell (CMD or PowerShell).
Or, if a "bash" tool is intended, AgenticSeek should ensure it correctly invokes a bash interpreter environment (e.g., WSL, Git Bash) on Windows.
File creation and verification steps should function reliably on Windows.
Safety filters should ideally allow for common agent tasks like writing generated code to files in a secure manner.

Environment:

Operating System: Windows 11 Pro (Version 24H2, OS build 26100.3775)
Python Version: 3.10.11 (installed from python.org)
LLM Provider: LM Studio (previously also tested with Ollama)
Relevant Hardware: AMD Ryzen 5 5600X, 32GB RAM, AMD Radeon RX 7800 XT

Key Issues Observed:

Bash-Specific Syntax in CMD:

Commands generated by the agent frequently include bash-specific syntax. For example, using # at the beginning of a line for comments:
```
Tool: bash
# Verify file creation and content
type F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt
Feedback: [failure] Error in execution: Command cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && # Verify file creation and contenttype F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt failed with return code 1: '#' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
```
This immediately fails in Windows CMD.
Another example is the use of echo -e for interpreting backslash escapes (like \n for newlines):
Command Generated: cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && echo -e "Movie1\nMovie2\nMovie3" > movies.txt
Actual Result on Windows: The file movies.txt is created containing the literal string -e "Movie1\nMovie2\nMovie3", not the movies on separate lines. AgenticSeek reported this as [success] presumably because the command ran without an OS error, but the output was incorrect.

File Not Found Errors:

Even when a command is syntactically valid for Windows CMD (e.g., after the agent "corrects" a command by removing the #), it sometimes fails because the target file wasn't found:
```
Tool: bash
type F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt
Feedback: [failure] Error in execution: Command cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && type F:\agentic_seek_workspace\movie_night.txt failed with return code 1: The system cannot find the file specified.
```
This suggests that the preceding step (which should have created the file) might also be failing or saving the file in an unexpected way/location.
"Unsafe Command" Aborts by AgenticSeek:

When attempting to write a multi-line Python script to a .py file using an echo "..." > script.py command (even if the syntax was made CMD-compatible), AgenticSeek's internal safety filter aborted the action:
```
Tool: bash
cd F:\agentic_seek_workspace && echo "python_script_content..." > news_scraper.py
Feedback: [failure] Error in execution: Unsafe command: {command}. Execution aborted. This is beyond allowed capabilities report to user.
```
This prevents agents from creating scripts or more complex files using this method.

Incorrect Command "Corrections" by Agent:

The agent's attempts to correct failing commands sometimes reintroduce invalid syntax or suggest entirely inappropriate commands for the task (e.g., suggesting certutil -verifystore "My" ... to verify file content).


Attempted Mitigation (Modifying Agent Prompt):
I attempted to modify the prompt for the file_agent (found in file_agent.txt) to explicitly instruct the LLM to generate Windows CMD-compatible commands even when using the "bash" tool. This helped reduce the # comment errors but did not fully resolve issues like the echo -e usage or the "Unsafe command" blocks.

Expected Behavior:
For robust Windows support, agents performing shell operations should:

Generate commands compatible with the native Windows shell (CMD or PowerShell).
Or, if a "bash" tool is intended, AgenticSeek should ensure it correctly invokes a bash interpreter environment (e.g., WSL, Git Bash) on Windows.
File creation and verification steps should function reliably on Windows.
Safety filters should ideally allow for common agent tasks like writing generated code to files in a secure manner.

issues.title: docker_deployement branch - chromedriver exit when run in docker
issues.body:
I am currently working on docker deployement on the `docker_deployement` branch but I am kind of stuck on the following issue, if anyone know or find a solution feel free to reply or send a message on discord. Probably not very difficult but didn't have the time to finish.

The issue is that I want to run the backend in docker (currently it's the only service run on host), I am implementing required change on the docker_deployement branch, it's almost finished, except that the backend service keep exiting due to a error with selenium.

To help with solving:

- checkout to `docker_deployement` branch I am currently working on
-  start with`./start_services.sh full` **yes, you need to add "full" as argument to the script**
- You should see the same log as below, the web driver exit with code 255
- Find a workaround

```
backend   | Traceback (most recent call last):
backend   |   File "/app/api.py", line 109, in <module>
backend   |     interaction = initialize_system()
backend   |   File "/app/api.py", line 65, in initialize_system
backend   |     create_driver(headless=config.getboolean('BROWSER', 'headless_browser'), stealth_mode=stealth_mode, lang=languages[0]),
backend   |   File "/app/sources/browser.py", line 199, in create_driver
backend   |     return webdriver.Chrome(service=service, options=chrome_options)
backend   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/chrome/webdriver.py", line 47, in __init__
backend   |     super().__init__(
backend   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/chromium/webdriver.py", line 58, in __init__
backend   |     self.service.start()
backend   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 106, in start
backend   |     self.assert_process_still_running()
backend   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 119, in assert_process_still_running
backend   |     raise WebDriverException(f"Service {self._path} unexpectedly exited. Status code was: {return_code}")
backend   | selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: Service /usr/local/bin/chromedriver unexpectedly exited. Status code was: 255
backend   | 
backend exited with code 1
```
issues.author: Fosowl

issues.title: Setting up a CI/CD
issues.body:
**1. Automated Testing Configuration:**
write a test suite for CI/CD setup --> link to https://github.com/Fosowl/agenticSeek/issues/52
- [ ] Define comprehensive test suites to ensure all critical functionalities are covered
- [ ] Implement these tests to run automatically upon PR creation or updates

**2. GitHub Actions Workflow Setup:**

- [ ] Create a .github/workflows/pr-validation.yml file
- [ ] Configure the workflow to trigger on pull_request events targeting branch

Include steps to:

- Checkout the code
- Install necessary dependencies
- Execute the test
- Report the outcomes

**3. Additional Checks Implementation:**

- [ ] Integrate linters to maintain code style consistency
- [ ] Set up security analysis tools to detect vulnerabilities
	
**4. Branch Protection Rules Configuration:**

- [ ] Require successful completion of the PR validation workflow before merging
- [ ] Mandate code reviews by designated team members prior to merging
issues.author: floriangab

issues.title: Installation Error
issues.body:
Subject: Troubleshooting Report: Agentic Seek Connection Failure on Windows with Local LLM Providers

Goal:
Install and run the Agentic Seek application (python cli.py) on Windows, configured to use a local LLM provider (initially LM Studio, later switched to Ollama).

System Configuration:

Operating System: Windows (detected as not Windows 11 by script ver | findstr /i "11.0.")
Python Version: 3.10.11 (Installed manually from python.org, added to PATH)
Initial Target Provider: LM Studio v0.2.14 with model lmstudio-community/DeepSeek-r1-distill-llama-8b-GGUF on http://127.0.0.1:1234
Current Target Provider: Ollama with model deepseek-coder:latest (or similar) on http://127.0.0.1:11434
Problem Encountered:
After completing installation steps, running python cli.py (or python api.py) consistently fails with a Python traceback ending in:
Exception: Server at http://127.0.0.1:[PORT] is offline.
This error occurred for both LM Studio (port 1234) and Ollama (port 11434) configurations.

Troubleshooting Steps Performed:

Initial Installer Script Issues: The provided .bat installer script (installer.txt) consistently failed early with syntax errors (". was unexpected...", "usually was unexpected...") likely due to file encoding/corruption issues (initially saved as UTF-8, later attempts with ANSI also failed at similar points). A minimal test script worked, but adding subsequent sections caused the early failure again. Switched to manual installation. ¬† 
Manual Installation:
Confirmed Git installation.
Manually created C:\AgenticSeek directory.
Cloned Agentic Seek repository directly into C:\AgenticSeek.
Manually created Python 3.10.11 virtual environment (agentic_seek_env) inside C:\AgenticSeek.
Activated virtual environment.
Upgraded pip, setuptools, wheel.
Installed specific dependency versions to fix known issues (playsound==1.2.2).
Installed Windows-specific dependency (pyreadline3) to resolve ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'readline'.
Installed provider-specific dependency (ollama) when switching configuration.
Installed all other dependencies via pip install -r requirements.txt.
Manually created workspace directory.
Manually created/verified config.ini with correct settings for the target provider (LM Studio or Ollama), including server address (http://127.0.0.1:[PORT]) and corrected work_dir (C:\AgenticSeek\workspace), saved as ANSI.
Server Verification:
Confirmed the target server (LM Studio or Ollama) was running via its own interface/service status.
Successfully tested direct connection to the server API using curl from the command line:
curl http://127.0.0.1:1234/v1/chat/completions ... (for LM Studio) returned a valid JSON response.
curl http://127.0.0.1:11434 (for Ollama) returned "Ollama is running".
Firewall Check: Temporarily disabled Windows Defender Firewall; the "Server... is offline" error in Agentic Seek persisted.
Python Version: Initially encountered issues possibly related to a Python 3.12 installation (Microsoft Store). Uninstalled previous versions and performed a clean install of Python 3.10.11 from python.org, ensuring it was added to PATH. The connection error still persisted after rebuilding the environment with this Python version.
Conclusion:
The LM Studio and Ollama servers are confirmed to be running correctly and are reachable from the local machine via standard tools (curl). The firewall is not blocking the connection. Python and all dependencies are installed correctly in a dedicated virtual environment. The config.ini points to the correct server address.

Despite this, the Agentic Seek Python application (both cli.py and api.py) is unable to establish a connection to either local server, consistently throwing a "Server... is offline" exception originating from its llm_provider.py connection check.

This strongly indicates an issue specific to how the Agentic Seek Python code (or the underlying Python networking libraries it uses) interacts with the network stack or makes localhost/127.0.0.1 connections within this specific Windows environment. The root cause is likely an incompatibility, a bug in Agentic Seek's connection handling, or a subtle system/network configuration issue affecting Python but not curl.
issues.author: Akshith-Anoop

issues.title: Planner agent adaptability / critics
issues.body: Currently planner agent will make a plan and execute in one shot, if something fail along the way it will not adapt and successive task will fail. Adapting to agent failure, having a critic for current current plan trajectory and changing plan over time is necessary

issues.title: web GUI
issues.body:
add a graphical interface

- Not boring: Move away from plain chat bubbles, make it feel immersive and interactive.
- Unique (Sci-fi inspired?) design: Take cues from futuristic UIs in movies while maintaining usability.
- Despite a unique design, the interface should remain intuitive.
- Preferably built in React Native, but open to other frameworks if justified.

This would need futher discussion as the current file structure does not allow for backend integration yet.

Any collaborators can pick up the task, just add a comment to this issue and I will assign you.

issues.title: Proper logging system
issues.body:
The current server script lacks a proper logging system, making debugging harder. We should replace the existing debug prints with Python‚Äôs logging module and ensure logs are written to a file while keeping user-facing messages clean.


-  Integrate Python‚Äôs logging module.
-  Log to a dedicated file instead of stdout.
 - Replace all debug/useless print() statements with appropriate logging levels (debug, info, warning, error).
 - Ensure pretty_print messages intended for users remain on stdout.
-  Clean up redundant or unnecessary debug prints.

Any collaborators can pick up the task, just add a comment to this issue and I will assign you.

useful because currently we remove anything that's not a sentence from the text page we send to the agent, so if there are numerical value, ai will miss them.

issues.title: Better server script
issues.body:
The current server script (server/server_ollama.py) needs improvements:

- Configurable arguments: Allow users to specify port, model, temperature, etc.
- Multiple LLM providers: Add support for vLLM and GGUF, while maintaining flexibility for future integrations.
- Refactoring: The script should be renamed or split into multiple files for better organization.

Tasks:
 - Add command-line arguments (e.g., --port, --model, --temperature).
-  Implement support for vLLM, hugging face and GGUF as local LLM backends.
 - Refactor the script (rename or split into multiple files as needed).
 - add documentation.

Any collaborators can pick up the task, just add a comment to this issue and I will assign you.
issues.author: Fosowl

issues.title: Fix display problem
issues.body: Fix display overlapping / cut output problem and duplicate message.
issues.author: Fosowl

issues.title: The cost of getting started is a bit high.
issues.body: Hello,I'm really attracted by the functions of AgenticSeek.However,after deploying it locally,I found that I don't know how to use it.I also couldn't find any detailed operation documents or videos.This has caused me a lot of trouble.I really hope that more complete usage examples can be provided.Thank you very much.
issues.author: msyJY

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: Thank you for the feedback, we will add a section in the readme to explain how to use it. could you tell what confused you and how did you try to use it ?

comments.author: msyJY
comments.body:
Since I couldn't find any detailed usage instructions for AgenticSeek,I tried the following:


‚Ä¢ Terminal Q&A:I was able to have normal conversations in English.The voice function also worked when the project was launched.


‚Ä¢ Voice Interaction:After the project was launched,there was no response wh

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: @msyJY I have updated the README on the dev branch, could you tell if you understand better the usage now ? what kind of messages did you send to the AI ?

comments.author: msyJY
comments.body: I asked the AI questions in Chinese and also tried to interact with it using voice,but there was no response.I haven't tried the latest version yet,but I still want to express my gratitude to you.

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body:
We currently don't support language other than english, you could type in chinese but the router will work poorly in choosing the right agent.
Have a look at readme there is a section related to speech to text that explain how to use it.

issues.title: Lm studio addition
issues.body: Please add lm studio for llm provider, I tried openai as lm studio also provides same endpoint but isn't working
issues.author: legendtharun

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: okay will look into it

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: Hello LM studio has now been implemented

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body:
this is a config example:

[MAIN]
is_local = True
provider_name = lm-studio
provider_model = lmstudio-community/gemma-2-2b-it-GGUF # dont use this one, was just for testing
provider_server_address = http://127.0.0.1:1234
agent_name = Friday
recover_last_session = True
save_session = True
speak = Fal

issues.title: Web agent youtube navigation
issues.body:
Find the way to prevent the web agent from going to youtube instead use https://summarize.tech/ (is there api for this ?) with the link to give the agent the video summary instead of the youtube page text.
Otherwise the agent will get stuck watching youtube video forever
issues.author: Fosowl

issues.title: Agent router does not support multilingual prompt
issues.body:
The router one-shot classification only work in english, other language will result in a random agent being selected for the task

Example:
When asking "search the web for what agenticSeek is" in chinese it select the coder agent

 Selected agent: coder (roles: coding and programming)

issues.title: self.driver = webdriver.Chrome(service=service, options=chrome_options) [ERROR]
issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
After running 'python main.py' the following error occurs.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\%USERNAME%\agenticSeek\sources\browser.py", line 44, in __init__
    self.driver = webdriver.Chrome(service=service, options=chrome_options)
                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

    super().__init__(
  File "C:\Users\%USERNAME%\agenticSeek\agentic_seek_env\Lib\site-packages\selenium\webdriver\chromium\webdriver.py", line 66, in __init__
    super().__init__(command_executor=executor, options=options)
  File "C:\Users\%USERNAME%\agenticSeek\agentic_seek_env\Lib\site-packages\selenium\webdriver\remote\webdriver.py", line 250, in __init__
    self.start_session(capabilities)
  File "C:\Users\%USERNAME%\agenticSeek\agentic_seek_env\Lib\site-packages\selenium\webdriver\remote\webdriver.py", line 342, in start_session
    response = self.execute(Command.NEW_SESSION, caps)["value"]
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.  Install as instructed
2.  Run 'Python main.py'

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

 - Browser: Chrome 
 - Version:  134.0.6998.89

If I made any mistakes please advise, thank you
issues.author: kairushinjuu

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body:
this seem like a version mismatch between your browser and chromedriver. could you update the latest chromedriver:

because you are using a very recent chrome version you need to check out : https://googlechromelabs.github.io/chrome-for-testing/

and download : https://storage.googleapis.com/chrome-

comments.author: ganeshnikhil
comments.body: I have made chages to autoinstall chromedriver and version update.

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: please @kairushinjuu confirm this work so i can close the issue

comments.author: kairushinjuu
comments.body:
@Fosowl Yes thank you, I updated the chromedriver now.

 I am now dealing with a different issue though I am afraid.

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: can you raise another issue then  @kairushinjuu ?

issues.title: Find serpApi alternative: Error during web search: 429 Client Error: Too Many Requests
issues.body:
This error can happen when the serpapi key expire.


 Error during web search: 429 Client Error: Too Many Requests for url: https://serpapi.com/search?q=search+the+web+for+the+weather+in+barcelona&api_key=xxxxxxxxx&num=50&output=json

 Is there a api we could use with no limit ?
Raising an issue in high priority as this will quickly happen to some users and i am open to suggestion for alternative.
issues.author: Fosowl

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: implementing searxng as an alternative : https://github.com/Fosowl/searxng-agentic

comments.author: Fosowl
comments.body: done, see dev branch

issues.title: Add conversation history system.

issues.title: Add more code execution to support C, Golang, etc..
issues.body:
Add support for executing C code within the agent's environment.
Add support for executing Golang code within the agent's environment.
Add support for more language....
Ensure the agent can handle compilation, runtime errors, and output generation for these languages.
